name: Garrison Keillor's "A Prairie Home Companion" Trivia Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: Garrison Keillor claims to be from what small Minnesota town?
questions.explanation:
Lake Wobegon.

	This is a small fictitious town of mostly Lutherans.  He brings the news from Lake Wobegon every week in his monologue, usually near the end of the show.

questions.text: Where is Garrison Keillor really from?
questions.explanation:
Anoka.

	He was born in Anoka in 1944.

questions.text: Which is not a feature on the show?
questions.explanation:
They all are.

	"Guy Noir" appears almost every week, "The Lives of The Cowboys" is less regular, and the "Story of Bob" is a rarity.

questions.text: Which sponsor's commercials often begin with "These are the good years for Barb and me"?
questions.explanation:
Ketchup Advisory Board.

	The usual KAB commercial -- things are going well for the couple, then one is feeling blue about something, and the other suggests more ketchup in their diet.  It ends with a song, whose lyrics are different each time.

questions.text: What is the name of the Café Boufe's Maitre D'e?
questions.explanation:
Maurice.

	Maurice is easily offended when it comes to French culture and food and how ignorant of it people are.

questions.text: Who is opposed to his bartender saying "Whatever" and "No problem"?
questions.explanation:
Guy Noir & Guy & Noir.

	Jimmy is the bartender; the Five-Spot is the bar."No problem."  "Don't say no problem."  "Okay... whatever."

questions.text: Garrison Keillor brings the news from Lake Wobegon every week in his monologue.  Who is the mayor of Lake Wobegon?
questions.explanation:
Eloise Krebsbach.

	Mr. Halvorson is the superintendent of the high school; the graduating class plays pranks on him every year.

questions.text: What won't you find in Lake Wobegon?
questions.explanation:
The Five-Spot.

	The Five-Spot is Guy Noir's favorite bar.  Guy doesn't live in Lake Wobegon.

questions.text: Who is not an actor on the show?
questions.explanation:
Rich Dworsky.

	Rich Dworsky is the pianist.

questions.text: In 2003, how long was "A Prairie Home Companion"?
questions.explanation:
Two hours.

	In 2003, "A Prairie Home Companion" aired every Saturday from 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM (Eastern time) on NPR, and then the same episode aired again on Sunday from 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM.
